multiple-choice.question: What is the primary purpose of the TED-Ed website?

options.label: A
options.text: To provide a platform for users to create and share their own educational content.

options.label: B
options.text: To host educational videos created by professional animators.

options.label: C
options.text: To offer a comprehensive library of educational resources for teachers and learners.

options.label: D
options.text: To facilitate online discussions among educators and learners.

multiple-choice.question: How can users browse the TED-Ed library?

options.label: A
options.text: By searching for specific keywords or topics.

options.label: B
options.text: By browsing through two different lenses: "Series" and "Subject".

options.label: C
options.text: By filtering lessons based on their own preferences.

options.label: D
options.text: By accessing a comprehensive index of all available lessons.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the "Quick Quiz" section in a lesson?

options.label: A
options.text: To provide additional resources for exploring the topic.

options.label: B
options.text: To offer open-answer questions for learners to respond.

options.label: C
options.text: To check for basic comprehension of the video.

options.label: D
options.text: To provide real-time feedback on learners' participation.

multiple-choice.question: How can users track their learning across the site?

options.label: A
options.text: By completing lessons anonymously.

options.label: B
options.text: By logging in and accessing the "Recent Activity" feed.

options.label: C
options.text: By sharing their progress with others.

options.label: D
options.text: By accessing a comprehensive report of their learning.

multiple-choice.question: What does flipping a lesson on the TED-Ed website involve?

options.label: A
options.text: Creating a new lesson from scratch.

options.label: B
options.text: Editing the title, selecting or deselecting "Quick Quiz" questions, and adding open-answer questions.

options.label: C
options.text: Publishing the lesson to a new and unique URL without editing.

options.label: D
options.text: Sharing the lesson with others without editing.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary benefit of flipping a lesson on the TED-Ed website?

options.label: A
options.text: To create a new and unique lesson for learners.

options.label: B
options.text: To measure the progress of any learner you share it with.

options.label: C
options.text: To provide additional resources for exploring the topic.

options.label: D
options.text: To check for basic comprehension of the video.

multiple-choice.question: Can users flip any video from YouTube on the TED-Ed platform?

options.label: A
options.text: Yes, they can create a lesson around any TED Talk, TEDx Talk, or other educational videos on YouTube.

options.label: B
options.text: No, they can only flip TED-Ed videos.

options.label: C
options.text: Yes, but only if they have a premium subscription.

options.label: D
options.text: No, they can only flip videos that are already on the TED-Ed platform.
